column4: Parker Hannifin to buy Lord Corp for about $3.68 billion
column5: (Reuters) - U.S. industrial conglomerate Parker Hannifin Corp said on Monday it would buy privately held adhesives and coatings maker Lord Corp for about $3.68 billion in cash, in a move to strengthen its aerospace and defense businesses.
column6: Lord also provides vibration and motion control technologies used in the aerospace, automotive and industrial markets.
column7: Cary, North Carolina-based Lord, which has annual sales of about $1.1 billion, will expand Parker Hannifin’s engineered materials business, which makes sealing devices for markets including aerospace, defense and automotive.
column8: Parker Hannifin’s engineered materials business is part of its larger diversified industrial unit, which reported sales of $11.98 billion in 2018, constituting about 84 percent of the company’s overall revenue.
column9: The deal is expected to close within the next four to six months, Parker Hannifin said.
column10: Barclays served as financial adviser to Parker and Morgan Stanley was Lord’s financial adviser.

column4: Parker Hannifin to buy LORD Corp for about $3.68 bln
column5: April 29 (Reuters) - U.S. industrial conglomerate Parker Hannifin Corp said on Monday it would buy privately held LORD Corp for about $3.68 billion in cash.
column6: Cary, North Carolina-based LORD makes adhesives, coatings, and vibration and motion control technologies used in the aerospace, automotive and industrial markets.
column7: Barclays served as financial adviser to Parker and Morgan Stanley was LORD’s financial adviser. (Reporting by Ankit Ajmera in Bengaluru; Editing by James Emmanuel)
